item.title: Report E-2025010389
item.description:
Report E-2025010389

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-29
  • City: MUSKOGEE
  • State: OK
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 29, 2025, two (2) 55-gallon drums of UN2810 released approximately fifteen (15) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the site. EWI personnel utilized hand tools and absorbents to remediate the impacted loading dock floor. The damaged drums were overpacked into two (2) 85-gallon overpacks and all impacted material and absorbents were collected and containerized into one (1) 55-gallon drum.

item.title: Report E-2025010399
item.description:
Report E-2025010399

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 23, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of UN1791 was punctured in transit and released approximately one-half (0.5) gallon of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from EnviroServe (ES) to remediate the site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remove the released product. All waste was containerized in one (1) 15-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 95-gallon overpack.

item.title: Report E-2025010404
item.description:
Report E-2025010404

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: HENDERSON
  • State: CO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 22, 2025 while conducting a site walk at Veolia's 10 day intransit facility in Henderson, CO an employee noticed free liquid around the bung of a drum that was loaded onto a trailer for outbound shipment. Approximately 3 ounces of UN3264 Waste Corrosive Liquid, Acidic, Inorganic, n.o.s. (nitric acid, sulfuric acid), 8, II, RQ (D002) released from the top bung of a drum (1H1) due to liquid expansion during freezing weather conditions. The container was removed from the trailer and was set aside to be overpacked. The impacted area was cleaned by Veolia personnel. No employee exposure or injury was reported.

item.title: Report E-2025010400
item.description:
Report E-2025010400

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-09
  • City: MURFREESBORO
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: FUEL SOUTH EXPRESS, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4998
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0745 ET, Danny Mabry with Circle K store # 4703699 notified ERTS of a premium gasoline release located in Murfreesboro, TN. It was reported that approximately 30 gallons released from Fuel South Express due to overfill. The release impacted concrete only. No storm drains or waterways are reported to be impacted by the release. ERTS proceed to dispatch a contractor to the site to complete cleanup activities. At 0920 on 1/9/25 HEPACO arrived onsite to the gasoline release. The gasoline that spilled impacted a 60' x 5' area on the asphalt parking lot. Oil dry is already placed down on the spill. The 30 gallon spill estimate is accurate. HEPACO worked on sweeping up the oil dry and will apply more after. HEPACO generated 2 55-gallon metal drums of gasoline impacted absorbents

item.title: Report I-2025010085
item.description:
Report I-2025010085

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-07
  • City: Port Allen
  • State: LA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SOUTHEASTERN FREIGHT LINES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On 01/06/2025 trailer 286454L arrived into BTR from MOB at 23:11 containing the 3 drum shipment on pro# 408307927. The trailer was set up for stripping at 23:30. On 01/07/2025 at 00:42, the shipment was moved& scanned to trailer 400195, located in door 25, by employee 53441. Approximately at 01:30 on 01/07/2025 trailer 400195 was being stripped for the Inbound operation. The employee stripping the trailer could smell the very strong odor of the chemical in the trailer. It was determined that one of the three drums had a fork hole in it& was Leaking. Safety was contacted& the proper channels were contacted from there. Louisiana State Police arrived on site& the in house clean up was performed. All items will be disposed of accordingly. After reviewing the cameras, considering the chemical is very thick& did not leave a trail. It was not determined if the order came into BTR Leaking. If the order was punctured during the initial off-loading of 286454L, or if the drum was punctured while off-loading 400195.

item.title: Report E-2025010408
item.description:
Report E-2025010408

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-06
  • City: Cedar Springs
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: SCHNEIDER NATIONAL BULK CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: This customer has a process in place where we scan multiple items on the trailer and customer set up before a lock code is given to unlock the fill line to be able to deliver. If that process isn't followed the driver is to call in and go through some manual verifications. That didn't happen and the unload should not have happened. Additionally a customer rep unlocked the fill line for him further bypassing protocols and they knew there was too much product for the tank to hold and that it would be a partial unload. The rep was going to tell him when to shut down. Ultimately that communication didn't happen and 3-4 gallons overflowed the tank down the sides and into the containment area. The rep rinsed down the sides of the tank into the containment drain.

  • Description: Delta's DG Management Group was notified of an e-Cig(vape pen) overheat event during flight of DL836/23Dec2024 (ATL-PHX). Not sure if it was a Hazmat shippment i drove out to location to check, once determined what was leaking Hazmat One was called at 15:54. Leak seemed to be a pin hole or a crack in the seam. Hazmat one arrived and while attempting to place drum in an over-pack the drum was dropped on the comer of another pallet creating a large gash and about 20 gal. was then released. All was cleaned up and 4 drums of debris was created plus the over-pack.

item.title: Report E-2024120147
item.description:
Report E-2024120147

Identified by scraper @ 2025-02-01T00:52:02+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-03
  • City: PARIS
  • State:
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 1
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: AT THE UPS FACILITY IN ROISSY, FRANCE, ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM CANADA TO FRANCE WAS BEING LOADED ONTO A PALLET FOR THE FINAL DELIVERY DESTINATION WHEN AN EXPLOSIVE SOUND WAS HEARD FOLLOWED BY SMOKE EMITTING FROM THE PACKAGE. THE FACILITY WAS PROMPTLY EVACUATED FOR APPROXIMATELY ONE HALF HOUR. THE LOCAL FIRE BRIGADE AND AIRPORT POLICE, AIR TRANSPORT GENDARMERIE (GTA) RESPONDED TO THE EVENT. PACKAGE INSPECTION REVEALS ONE ECO COUNTER URBAN POST (PEOPLE COUNTING SYSTEM) CONTAINING AN INSTALLED LITHIUM METAL BATTERY. THERE IS EVIDENCE OF A THERMAL LITHIUM BATTERY EVENT HAVING OCCURRED AS EVIDENT BY THE CHARRING AND BURNING MARKS ON THE DEVICE. THE PACKAGE WAS CONFISCATED BY THE GENDARMERIE DES TRANSPORTS AERIENS (GTA) FOR ANALYSIS. ONE EMPLOYEE HAD RINGING IN THE EARS AND WAS SENT TO THE HOSPITAL FOR EVALUATION. THE EMPLOYEE WAS RELEASED AND GIVEN THREE SICK LEAVE DAYS. THE PACKAGE WAS A RETURN SERVICE PACKAGE SHIPPED FROM CANADA TO THE PRODUCT OWNER IN FRANCE. THE OWNER OF THE UPS ACCOUNT IS 82F81F, ECO COMPTEUR, 4 RUE CHARLES BOURSEUL, LANNION FRANCE 22300. THE PACKAGE ENTERED THE NETWORK ON 18-NOV AND WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT YYZ TO SDF, SDF TO PHL, AND PHL TO CDG. THE PACKAGE ARRIVED IN CDG ON 20-NOV AND WAS NOT RELEASED FROM CUSTOMS UNTIL 02-DEC. NRC REPORT WAS MADE ON 06-DEC AS REQUIRED 171.15, NRC 1418132.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a fiberboard box was discovered with signs of a release. The fiberboard box contained six metal can all in a plastic bag with packing paper for dunnage. The screw cap on one of the cans was loose causing the release. All contents were placed into a steel salvage package and anew declaration will be obtained for movement.

  • City: WILMINGTON

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 28, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of methanol was punctured and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted site. The crew utilized absorbents and hand tools to remediate the impacted site. All impacted absorbents were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged drum was placed in one (1) 85-gallon overpack.

Spilled material was swept up and placed into a recovery container and the two bags were repaired and placed into a recovery container and sent to ultimate consignee.

THIS PACKAGE HAS NOT BEEN ACCEPTED FOR AIR OR TRANSPORTED IN THE AIR BY UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.

item.title: Report X-2025011082
item.description:
Report X-2025011082

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-26
  • City: ROGERS
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Federal Express Corporation
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A driver brought this package to QA's attention after picking it up at FedEx Office, 8057 WEDGEWOOD LN N, MAPLE GROVE, MN. Driver said the FXO employee explained strange situation that occurred with the customer dropping it off. The customer allegedly tried to offer it with Class 9 diamonds on it, but the FXO employee refused to accept, so the customer left and came back later with the Class 9 diamonds removed. FXO employee accepted it at that time but told driver about this. Driver told QA. The DG Nav specialist opened it for inspection and found that it contains a solar generator classified as UN3480. While there is a small UN3480 printed on the box, the customer seems to have deliberately removed the Class 9 diamonds to render it undeclared. Customer's return address is a business in Florida, but the last name connected to his first name in FAST when searching the business address appears fake. The phone number listed on the Fedex label is fake.

item.title: Report X-2025011179
item.description:
Report X-2025011179

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: EARTH CITY
  • State: MO
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AN UNLOADER IN UNLOAD E DISCOVERED A FULLY LABELED HAZMAT PACKAGE THAT APPEARED TO BE LEAKING. HE LEFT THE AREA AND NOTIFIED HIS SUPERVISOR. WITHIN 3 MINUTES A DMP RESPONDER ARRIVED DONNING THE CORRECT PPE WITH A FULLY STOCKED SPILL CART. USING THE DECISION TREE AND CORRECT RESPONSE SHEET IT WAS DETERMINED THAT THE PACKAGE COULD BE SAFELY TRANSPORTED BACK TO THE DMP. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION IT WAS REVEALED THAT THE LID ON THE INNER 5 GALLON JERRICAN APPEARED TO BE MISSING A RUBBER GASKET AND THE LID WAS UNABLE TO MAKE A WATERTIGHT SEAL WHICH RESULTED IN 6 OUNCES OF LIQUID LEAKING OUT ONTO THE FIBERBOARD CARTON.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately fifteen (15) gallons of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to improperly loading freight that resulted in the drum being punctured due to a forklift accident. The released material impacted the trailer floor and dock floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 55-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010293
item.description:
Report E-2025010293

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-23
  • City: ELLENWOOD
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: XPO-Logistics contacted ERTS regarding an industrial battery that fell over during the off-loading process leaking battery acid. A contractor dispatched and observed an estimated 20-gallon release onto the wooden dock floor in a 6’ x 8.5’ area and the concrete beneath the trailer in a 53’ x 10’ area. The contractor applied oil dry to the release and up-righted the dropped battery. The impacted absorbents, pallet pieces, and nylon cable were containerized into two 55-gallon DF’s for waste disposal. The battery was cleaned and re-palletized to ship onto the Consignee. XPO will manage all waste created from the response. No storm-drains, waterways or soil were involved in this incident.

item.title: Report X-2025011166
item.description:
Report X-2025011166

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: ADDISON
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ON THE OUTBOUND AT BAY 459, SUPERVISOR DISCOVERED LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE ON THE GRATING AND NOTIFIED RMP ABOUT NEEDING A RESPONDER TO CLEAN UP THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE. RMP SENDED THE RESPONDER TO BAY 459 AND THE RESPONDER ARRIVED WITH PPE ON, STOCKED SPILL CART, AND CURRENT DECISION TREE. RESPONDER LOOKED AT THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE AND THEN READ AND FOLLOWED THE CURRENT DECISION TREE, WHICH LED THEM TO THE FLAMMABLE LIQUID RESPONSE SHEET. RESPONDER SUCCESSFULLY CONTAINED THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE WITH ZEP ZORBENT SINCE THATS WHAT THE CURRENT RESPONSE SHEET HAD ON AND CLEANED UP ZEP ZORBENT REMAINS AROUND THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE. RESPONDER TOOK BACK THE LEAKING FLAMMABLE HAZMAT PACKAGE TO THE PSC CAGE AND BEGAN PROCESSING.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately two (2) cups of material released from one (1) 1-gallon metal pails due to it falling off a skid that resulted in the pails being damaged. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed absorbent pads and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon metal drum. They also used one (1) 10-gallon metal drum for the left-over product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

The damaged pails were containerized into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Green Site Services Group, Inc. (GSSG) to remediate the site. The crew collected all released material in one (1) 55-gallon drum and the damaged bags in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025011010
item.description:
Report X-2025011010

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-22
  • City: NORTH LITTLE ROCK
  • State: AR
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Union Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 1000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon notification from Mr. Kyzer, I advised him to isolate tracks on either side of this car until the car could be assessed. Code 3 was contacted and mobilized a crew. I was enroute as well. Upon arrival it was determined that the car was dripping from the bottom outlet stem packing gland due to the packing retainer nuts being several turns loose. The nuts were equally tightened until the leak stopped. The car was observed for several minutes, and no drips or leaks were observed. The bottom outlet was wiped dry, and the car was placed in HZ hold until an OTMA could be obtained by the shipper. Less than 1/2 gallon released and evaporated.

item.description:
Report E-2025010298

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: SAUGET
  • State: IL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A third party driver was delivering drums to Veolia's 10-day intransit facility in Sauget, IL. As the driver was backing up, the trailer backed into a pallet of drums that were staged to be loaded onto a 10-day trailer. One of the drums was damaged by the underride bar on the back of the trailer, resulting in the drum to starting to leak. Approximately 10 gallons of waste flammable liquids was spilled onto an impervious surface. The spill was contained and cleaned up appropriately, and the damaged drum was overpacked for continued transportation to the disposal facility.

item.title: Report X-2025011244
item.description:
Report X-2025011244

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-21
  • City: ANCHORAGE
  • State: AK
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: LAW ENFORCEMENT AGENT WAS PERFORMING AN OBSERVATION OF OPERATIONS WHEN THEY FLAGGED A PACKAGE AS SUSPICIOUS AND REQUESTED CONTENT INSPECTION. THE PACKAGE WAS WRAPPED WITH BROWN KRAFT PAPER. ANCHORAGE UPS SECURITY LEAD OPENED THE PACKAGE FOR INSPECTION. UPON INSPECTION OF THE CONTENTS DISCOVERED A TOTAL OF SEVENTEEN CANISTERS OF #11 EXPLOSIVE PERCUSSION CAPS. THERE ARE ALSO FOUR PACKETS OF #11 REVOLVER NIPPLES AND ONE PAIR OF EQUATE +2.00 READER GLASSES. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER PACKAGING.THE PACKAGE WAS FLOWN ON UPS AIRCRAFT FROM SDF TO ANC.

  • City: EAGAN
  • State: MN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When moving pallets of waste around in warehouse the warehouseman was trying to double stack a pallet onto another skid of drum and the pallet was not stable and the drum tipped over and fell off the pallet to the ground. This happened at 1530 ct. They though down some absorbent and the called for a response team that is located on sight to properly clean up the material. The facility is in containment so there was no threat to the environment. The team began the clean up and repacking of the damaged drum into an salvage drum for shipment. The absorbents and material that was collected was then packaged up to be disposed of in the proper manner. The clean up was completed at 1730 ct.

  • Description: On January 20, 2025, at 1309 ET, Emergency Response and Training Solutions (ERTS) was contacted by Landstar Inway personnel in Laredo, TX regarding the release of Reze-Meric 9772. Contractors were dispatched to the site to perform all onsite clean-up activities. Upon arrival, contractors confirmed the release of 1.0 ounce of Reze-Meric 9772 (UN1866, 3, II) from (2) 231-gallon poly totes onto the (2) totes. The release was reportedly due loose caps, impacting multiple areas on top of the leaked totes. No drains or waterways were impacted by the release. The release was cleaned up with absorbents and the proper PPE. Contractors tightened the caps on all totes of product and no totes were found to be damaged. All waste generated from addressing this release was containerized in (1) 5-gallon DF, which was then taken offsite by the contractor for proper disposal.

  • Description: On 01/18/2025 at approximately 1230, Dangerous Goods Administration received a call from Employee 868809 at the hub facility in Indianapolis, reporting a hazardous material spill. The shipment consisted of 4 metal cans packaged a fiberboard box. Due to mishandling, the shipment was damaged, resulting in spillage, completely covering the package in paint, rendering the marks and labels illegible. 1 of the 4 metal cans was found completely empty. The undamaged cans were placed in a salvage drum and awaits an amended Shipper's declaration for further transport.

  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of Klean Strip Acetone released from one (1) gallon metal pail and one (1) gallon of Citristrip Stripping Gel released from two (2) half-gallon plastic jugs due to improperly loaded freight that resulted in the pails from falling and cracking. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum and one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: EDGEWOOD
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On January 17, 2025, one (1) 55-gallon drum of heptane was damaged and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the trailer and gravel beneath. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Environmental Works, Inc. (EWI) to remediate the impacted site. The crew overpacked the damaged drum in one (1) 95-gallon drum. The crew utilized absorbent pads and granular absorbents to clear the areas. All waste was containerized in one (1) 16-gallon drum for disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025010291
item.description:
Report E-2025010291

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: RIVERVIEW
  • State: MI
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: VEOLIA ES TECHNICAL SOLUTIONS, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: On January 17th, 2025, at 12:34, a three-person Veolia team was conducting operations at the ASH Stevens customer site. The Veolia employees were in the process of loading totes onto a box truck using an electric pallet jack. The Veolia box truck was positioned at the customer's loading dock. During the loading procedure, an incident occurred when a tote situated near the front of the box truck (one of the first to be loaded) was accidentally punctured. This happened as the pallet jack operator was attempting to place a second tote behind it, towards the rear/open end of the truck. The puncture occurred in the left-hand lower quadrant of the 275-gallon tote. As a result, the contents began to leak, flowing from the front of the box truck towards the rear while it was still in the loading dock. The leaking material spilled off the truck and into the customer's secondary containment system, where it was successfully contained. The customer's team promptly responded to the situation by transferring the remaining contents of the damaged tote into a new, undamaged container. They also managed to recover the spilled material from the secondary containment area. It is estimated that less than 250 gallons of the material was lost to the customer's containment system.

item.title: Report E-2025010345
item.description:
Report E-2025010345

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-17
  • City: KENT
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CLEAN HARBORS ENVIRONMENTAL SERVICES, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: When facility was going to move around trailers to be loaded/unloaded it was noticed that material was dripping out the doors of the trailer around 1230 et. The put down absorbent to contain any runoff and begin absorbing the material. They opened the doors of the trailer to find that a drum had tipped over in transit. They then call for a team to come out and clean up the material that had release. The team arrived at 1445 et to review the information and began creating a plan. 1600 et the needed equipment and proper PPE needed arrived and the work began on the clean up. They uprighted the drum and began cleaning up any material that had released to the trailer and the pavement. The bung were checked and tightened and the absorbents that were used to clean up the material were placed into drums and disposed of properly. The clean up was completed at 2100 et.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from three (3) 1-gallon metal pails fox a box containing four (4) 1-gallon pails were crushed due to improperly loaded freight. The released material impacted the trailer floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 10-gallon poly drum for all waste. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Norfolk Southern personnel reported a slight smell emanating from ETCX 21090. Upon inspection by a contractor, it was determined that the release was the result of the bolts on the Vapor Valve mounting flange were less than tool tight. These bolts were tightened, and the leak was stopped. There was no impact to the surrounding area. New Seals were placed, and the Shipper was notified.

  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Dayton Freight personnel observed approximately one (1) gallon of material released from one (1) 55-gallon metal drum due to a forklift accident that resulted in the pails being punctured. The released material impacted the concrete floor. Dayton Freight personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted area and gathered the spent material and containerized it into one (1) 5-gallon poly drum. They also generated a 65-gallon metal drum of waste product. The generated waste was staged onsite at the terminal in a secure location. The generated waste will remain onsite for Dayton Freight’s contracted hazardous waste vendor to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report X-2025010864
item.description:
Report X-2025010864

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-14
  • City: LOUISVILLE
  • State: KY
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: UNITED PARCEL SERVICE CO.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: AT THE UPS WORLDPORT FACILITY IN LOUISVILLE, KENTUCKY ONE AIR PACKAGE FROM SPAIN TO PERU WAS COVERED WITH BLACK SHRINK WRAPPING. THE BLACK COVERING WAS TORN DURING PACKAGE HANDLING REVEALING A CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABEL ON AN INNER BOX. UPON FURTHER INSPECTION WE DISCOVERED THE SHIPMENT CONTAINED TWO INNER BOXES WITH CLASS 9 LITHIUM BATTERY DIAMOND LABELS, UN3091 LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES CONTAINED IN EQUIPMENT AND EMERGENCY CONTACT NUMBER (001) 352-323-3500 THAT HAD BEEN COVERED. TWO CORUS EVO+ GAS VOLUME CONVERTER POWERED WITH LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES WERE CONTAINED IN THE BOXES. THE LITHIUM METAL BATTERIES ARE OVER 2 GRAMS OF EQUIVALENT LITHIUM METAL CONTENT. THERE ARE NO DANGEROUS GOODS MARKS OR LABELS ON THE OUTER BOX. THIS PACKAGE WAS SHIPPED FROM SPAIN USING UPS ACCOUNT NUMBER A24F24, HAM CRIOGENICA SL, 1 PROGRES C, ABRERA SPAIN 18630.

item.title: Report I-2025010063
item.description:
Report I-2025010063

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-08
  • City: Miami
  • State: FL
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At ® proximately 06:57 hours for Flight 1755/SNU, ramp CSM notified the team of a passenger bag that was leaking. At the time, it was unclear whether the contents included a Dangerous Goods(DG) item. Customer HERNANDEZ/LEIDYS was identified as owner of the Leaking bag. Upon further investigation; it was disc6vered that passenger Hernandez had checked in early that morning at 03:41 hours for a later flight, FLT 1579/SNU, scheduled to depart at 12:40 hours. Despite this, her checked bag, tag#6001958417, was scanned and mistakenly loaded into Flight 1755 at 06:31 hours in the F2 compartment. A few minutes later, at 06:33 hour's, the FSC identified that the bag was Leaking and immediately removed it from the aircraft. Following the removal of the bag, Miami Fir6 Rescue and Environmental Coordinator Viviana Traverso were contacted to assess. Upon opening the bag, it was found to contain a broken gallon of muriatic acid, a can of primer paint, a used pool pump motor and other products. Some other bags were affected by contact with the acid but they had not been loaded on the aircraft.

  • City: EAGAN

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0

  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0

  • Description: When performing a facility inspection it was noticed that a dropped trailer had liquid dripping from it around 1530 ct. They the thorough down absorbent to prevent any spread of the material and to begin absorbing it. The facility has a emergency response team located on site and they began the process of cleaning it up. The trailer was unloaded and 3 drum appeared to be swell up and the material was being pushed out of the bungs. The material consisted of mostly water and the drums had frozen causing the expansion. The team released the pressure and placed them into salvage drums. The rest of the material was then cleaned up and disposed of in the appropriate manner. The clean up was completed by 1730 ct. approximately 1 gallon was released.

item.title: Report X-2025010968
item.description:
Report X-2025010968

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-05
  • City: WATERLOO
  • State: IA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Rail
  • Carrier/Reporter: Chicago Central and Pacific Railroad
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 18000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On Sunday, January 5th, 2025, a CN mechanical performing an inspection observed that the bottom outlet valve appeared to be leaking from tank car # SHQX 70932 along with a strong Ethanol type odor in the area. The employee notified the Waterloo Yard Master who in turn notified the CN Dangerous Goods Team. The tank car was set out to an isolation track (WA90) for inspection by a CN emergency response contractor. A CN emergency response contractor was dispatched to the location for mitigation. The contractor performed an inspection of the tank car and found the bottom outlet valve to be leaking from the threads of the bottom outlet valve cap. (The BOV cap was found to be less than tool tight and the BOV handle was disengaged and pinned upon initial inspection). Also, the car seal provision indicator was not properly engaged according to the BOV diagram provided on the car. Cap was tightened and the BOV valve was inspected. The BOV valve handle was cycled exposing the valve was in the open position. The BOV cap was then removed and observed for 20 minutes to ensure there was no further leakage from the valve. The BOV cap gasket was replaced. The bottom outlet valve cap was then re-installed and tightened with a 36" pipe wrench. Upon tightening the BOV cap, CN emergency response contractor proceeded to place new cable seals on the BOV / Cap. Position

item.description:
Report E-2025010369

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-01-03
  • City: EAST BRUNSWICK
  • State: NJ
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Carrier/Reporter: A. DUIE PYLE INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 9700
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: When unloading freight from trailer forklift operator was carrying the tote on the forkblades of the forklift. As the forklift was transitioning from the trailer to the dock over the dock plate the IBC started to wobble on the forkblades. The forklift operator tried to move forward back on to the trailer and when doing so the IBC fell over causing the lid to partially rupture contributing to the unintentional release. Defensive actions were immediately taken to contain the spilled material and an outside spill response company was dispatched to aid in mitigating and cleaning up the spilled material. The spilled material was cleaned up by an outside company and placed into multiple recovery containers for disposal.

  • Description: According to the information obtained, the following occurred. While unloading, one 2.5 gallon jug fell from pallet and was damaged. Free product released to trailer floor and gravel surface beneath. Valley Environmental was dispatched to perform the cleanup. Upon arrival on site, Valley Environmental applied absorbent material to the affected areas and neutralized the free product, which was recovered into one 55-gallon recovery drum, along with contaminated cardboard and debris. The damaged 2.5g jug was placed into one 10-gallon overpack drum and secured with absorbent boom. Disposal was coordinated in accordance with local, state, and federal regulations. There were no injuries or exposures reported.

item.title: Report I-2025010077
item.description:
Report I-2025010077

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-20
  • City: Los Angeles
  • State: CA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: AMERICAN AIRLINES GROUP INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Customer came to the back of the aircraft to alert us, that his backpack had gotten wet some how and the batteries in his computers were hissing and you could smell a burning smell. We put them in the Fire containment bag. I then went to customers seat to find out how his bag got wet and he said, he didn't know, but his whole bag was wet and everything in it. He said, he had no water in his bag at all. At that moment, the guy in seat 15D, turns around and says, that he spilled a little water under his seat, where customers bag was stowed. It wasn't little water, it was a lot of water. Anyway, two managers met the flight and took both gentlemen off the plane for questioning. Considered this to be more of a short circuiting of laptop than a thermal runaway. Water can sizzle in electrified circuitry.

item.title: Report I-2025010050
item.description:
Report I-2025010050

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: El Paso
  • State: TX
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: PVS-NOLWOOD CHEMICALS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 4370
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Upon arrival to Ft. Bliss to deliver chlorine cylinders, the customer noticed liquid on the back of the truck which was not present at check in at security. Upon investigation, the driver found the 330 gallon tote of 12.5 wt% sodium hypochlorite to be Leaking. The entire contents of the tote then drained on to the ground. There was no way to stop the leak as it was determined that the bladder had a crack in it at the bottom of the IBC and could not be safely stopped. The area was secured with no personnel exposure. Once a reportable quantity was calculated, NRC was contacted as well as TCEQ and reported the incident. An environmental company, D&H Environmental Services was contacted for remediation. The company applied sodium thiosulfate to the area and tilled the soil. Sampling was done and will be retested in a couple of weeks to ensure the treatment is sufficient. If more treatment is needed, it will be done at that time.

  • Description: We had a situation on inbound flight 2868 from RDU to MIA. Passenger Early Yu reported that his Android cell phone was overheating and starting to expand. Concerned that it might catch fire, he alerted the flight attendant. The flight attendant promptly secured the device in an isolation package as a precaution. The captain, unsure of what to expect, declared an emergency landing. Fortunately, the plane landed safely without incident. After landing, we /checked in with the flight attendant crew regarding their experience during the emergency landing, and they reported feeling fine. The fire department advised the passenger on how to safely dispose of the device.

item.title: Report I-2025010073
item.description:
Report I-2025010073

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-12-16
  • City: MACON
  • State: GA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CARDINAL HEALTH 414, LLC
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: Yes
  • Description: While driving eastbound(speed unknown) on Highway 74 at approximately 6:00 AM on 12/16/2024, the vehicle hit a cow that was in the middle of the road. The driver reported heavy fog at the time of the collision. As a result of the collision, the vehicle left the roadway onto the eastbound shoulder of the road and burst into flames. The driver escaped the vehicle and called emergency medical services. h Upon theif arrival on the scene shortly after the accident, law enforcement closed the eastbound lane of the road. This lane of the road remained closed for several hours until being reopened following decontamination of the area in the evening on December 16. After the vehicle caught fire, the flames consumed the vehicle, 6reaching the shipping container and several of the unit dose shields and spreading some radioactive contamination in the general vicinity of the vehicle. EMS worked to extinguish the fire and in doing so, spread some contamination further around the area, reaching approximately 15-20 feet away from the vehicle. Two of the unit dose pigs were later identified in the debris, while another two items that may have been unit dose pigs were also identified. The other pigs appear to have fully melted in the fire and their materials released. It was not possible to identify which specific doses' pigs were intact. Cleanup was conducted by a contractor, Alpha-Omega Training& Compliance, Inc., with direction by Cardinal Health and a representative from the Georgia DNR Radioactive Materials Program. The area was found to be at background levels after cleanup concluded on the evening of 12/16.

item.title: Report X-2025011024
item.description:
Report X-2025011024

Identified by scraper @ 2025-01-31T00:56:40+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2024-11-19
  • City: RICHMOND
  • State: VA
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ABF Freight
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: ABF stated that while at a customer location, the ABF driver noticed that the commodity was leaking while attempting to unload it. ABF stated that the commodity was pulled out of the trailer and when they noticed it was leaking they put it back into the trailer. ABF advised that the commodity had le aking on the customer yard and the customer cleaned it up. I advised CURA to make sure the yard was cleaned properly.~~CURA has been contacted for remediation and will advise on the cause of damage.~~Project Manager: Lizzie Buck~~FCE has completed their remediation efforts. Crews donned the appropri ate PPE and identified the estimated one half (0.5) gallon release of Sunnyside muriatic acid (UN1789) to the trailer and pavement below. FCE personnel down stacked the pallet, removed one (1) damaged 1-gallon carton of product from the load, then neutralized and solidified the remaining product in the damaged jug. Crews determined the cause of the release was due to a forklift strike on the bottom of the pallet. The release was also not considered to be reportable to any regulatory agencies~
